authors: Harry Pearl For Daily Mail Australia
description: CCTV footage has caught the moment when a man delivers a sickening 'coward punch' outside a bar in Canberra.
title: CCTV footage catches 'coward punch' outside Canberra bar
title_page: CCTV footage catches 'coward punch' outside Canberra bar | Daily Mail Online
text:
Police are appealing to the public to help identify a man caught on video delivering a brutal 'coward punch' that sends his victim sprawling onto the pavement outside a Canberra bar.
CCTV footage released by police shows a verbal confrontation between a group of people and the victim, before he is hit on the side of the head in a one-punch attack and knocked to the ground.
After the man hits the pavement, he can be seen sprawled out on his back.
Police are appealing for information to help them identify the attacker in the video
'This is a cowardly act which will not be tolerated,' ACT police said on their Facebook page.
'This type of senseless violence can have tragic consequences; we know that just one punch can kill.'
Police have urged anyone shown in the video, as well as other witnesses, to come forward and speak with investigators.
The attack occurred outside PJ O’Reilly’s in Greenway at about 2.45 am on December 12.
Police want to identify the male offender, who is seen wearing a white T-shirt and black or blue pants in the video.
He's described as being between 5’9” and 6’ inches tall (175cm – 183cm) with light complexion and brown hair.
Anyone with information about the attack, or who can help identify the offender, can call contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.
